details.detail:
Rectangular neck double diptych with decorative coloured and carved ornamentation on the outer sides of the diptych wings, both of a yellow Greek pattée cross on a green background surrounded by smaller red cross ornamentation. Set in a yellow frame with cord carvings.
Side A, diptych body: Frontal view of Mary with the Child on her lap flanked by two angels armed with swords holding a red canopy. Both Mary and the Child are adorned with red and yellow double nimbi and depicted in rich garments: Mary is wearing a blue maphrion with flower ornamentation over red, striped undergarments. A bright yellow cross is adorning the front of the maphrion; a star is painted over her right shoulder. Jesus is garbed in striped yellow, with a green book in his left and extending his right hand in a gesture of blessing. In the background, the faces of the angels are shown in near frontal view with their swords framing Mary and the Child.
Side A, diptych wing: St. George killing the dragon. St. George, in striped green garments with a yellow and red shawl, is seated on a white steed with elaborate red tack. His spear is slanted downwards in the process of killing a green and yellow dragon with blue wings. A second figure in blue and red garb is in the right background (Birutawit). The background alternates from yellow to green to red.
Side B, diptych body: Scene from the Tortures of Christ: "Kwərˁatä Rəˀəsu" (Christ with the Crown of Thorns) surrounded by four henchmen who torture him. The haloed, bloodied Christ is depicted naked except for a green cloak; the torturers are dressed in bright, colourful clothing and tying his hands with rope or applying nails to his head. Plain yellow background.
Side B, diptych wing: Two haloed saints. Two saints in elaborate red and yellow clothing with white turbans each holding a cross and a book. Plain green background.
